key_points: Script supervisor Mamie Mitchell is suing Alec Baldwin and others after the fatal shooting on the 'Rust' movie set.
The incident, which occurred in October, resulted in the death of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins and injured director Joel Souza.
Attorney Gloria Allred stated that no rehearsal was in progress and the scene did not require a gun discharge according to the script.
Mitchell described the traumatic experience and its ongoing impact on her life.
She was the one to alert law enforcement about the shooting.
Mitchell has been a script supervisor for 40 years and had never experienced anything like the 'Rust' shooting.
There were safety concerns and protests over production conditions before the incident.
Santa Fe District Attorney Mary Carmack-Altwies expressed concern over safety failures and dismissed sabotage theories.
Serge Svetnoy, head of lighting, also filed a lawsuit alleging negligence and emotional distress.
Defendants in Svetnoy's lawsuit include Alec Baldwin, assistant director David Halls, and armorer Hannah Gutierrez Reed.
